laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The peripheral eosinophil count returned to normal on a peanut-free diet: 0.3 × 10^9/L.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Negative for milk, soya, egg, and wheat; erythema with fresh peanut.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At 12 months, significant reaction to commercial peanut extract (wheal of 15 mm), still negative for milk and soya, slightly positive for egg (wheal of 4 mm).

laboratory_examinations.findings: Positive for peanut: 0.47 IU/ml; not detectable for egg.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Total serum IgE was in the normal range with a level of 18 kU/L.
